I'm looking forward to joining you in July and hoping for that this trip to be is an amazing experience. Yours sincerely Pablo Picasso

Shopping can be painful As a child, I would be taken to the mall and be forced to go through all the shops and establishments just to please my mother, whose desire to buy, without any sort of control, all kinds of clothes and gadgets was something unbelievable. And due to these bizarre situations experiences I went through as a little boy, everything related to shopping seems like a bitter liquid which I'm forced to drink. It is difficult to see any enjoyment in shopping: facing the crowd, having to withstand the rude clerks and shop managers, trying desperately to choose the right thing - these burdens form the dark side of shopping. Certainly, buying things can be a pleasant activity, especially if you are acquiring the goods for yourself. But situations in which you do not need to move carefully in order to avoid stepping on someone's feet are quite rare and, when they do happen, time passes by very fast. However, if you are another fool standing amidst the crowd, waiting for the queue to move, time slowly melts. Believe me, shopping can also be painful. Your feet will turn into pancakes after a long day out in the streets and your muscles can get seriously injured after carrying all those bags which contain loads of objects. Amazingly, doctors tell people to look after their bodies during Christmas time: shopping can cause you a large variety of undesireble undesirable pains. Nonetheless, people still find some obscure pleasure in putting their mental health at stake risk. They keep claiming that there's no such thing as there's nothing better than shopping. In spite of our decadence, some cheap souls still have the courage to say that, by shopping, they're filling their empty spaces.

My friends lent me some money, but it wasn't more than 120 pounds. I had to buy my dress, it's its accesories accessories and besides also clothes and souvenirs! I couldn't really do much, so I used the money I had and bought an incredible pair of shoes and some souvenirs. I felt really bad seeing my friends buy the latest fashion while the only thing I could do was tell them how great their clothes were and of course window-shop.

"Shopping is not always enjoyable". Before we can give our opinions on this statemant statement we have to make sure that everyone knows what we are discussing about. 'Shopping' stands for means buying goods for your daily requirements, e.g. food, clothes. We do not speak here about luxuary luxury goods. In this contest context, shopping means a compulsory exercise you have to do regularly and frequently. It is not enjoyable if you look at on it as a duty. But if you realize how important it is for your health what you buy what you buy is for your health you will go shopping with much more a far greater consiousness consciousness and more joy than before. 'Shopping' could be annoying if you look at on it as a waste of time because you do it every day. Reorganize your behaviour of approach to shopping and plan to keep food in stock! Try the internet Internet and use e-business and online-shopping online shopping to order your pants for example. This is even an appropriate a good way to get around the unfriendly service you get to know if you have to buy something in a shop right before closing time. Choose your clothes at home after before you have ordered order them by e-mail! Another solution way to get a friendlier service is of course to go to another shop. You have been presented with some causes reasons why shopping is not always enjoyable. There are ways of behaviour to make more fun of it making it more fun. It depends on every individual to change your mind and act behave as like a 'smart' shopper.

Dear Mary, I'm really happy to hear from you! I've had so much work at school recently (exams!) and so many things to do, that I've almost forgotten how good it is to relax and rest a bit. Fortunately, the people from my class are really great and we all love trips - especially interesting ones. The boat trip you're you were asking about in your letter was really fantastic and well organized, there. There were absolutely no problems and we had lots of fun! Here are some facts for you: The departures are at 8 am and 10 a.m. every day, but it's much better to set off earlier as the boat is less crowded then (I know you hate getting up early, but...). After two hours of the cruise, there is a stop at the beautiful Bourne Castle where they offer guided tours. I think such a tour is essential, because you can learn lots of interesting things about the history of the castle. After visiting the castle there is lunch at a restaurant, but you'd better take a picnic - it's so beautiful there! In the afternoon you can choose from a variety of water sports at the lake. Try windsurfing, you'll have lots of fun! I'm telling you - the trip was wonderful and I'm sure your group will like it. Especially that because the prices are reasonable and if you have a group of 15 people, you get a discount. Try it and have fun! I'm looking forward to hearing from you, take. Take care,

It was three o'clock in the morning when the phone rang. I rushed to answer it, but when I picked up the phone, there was nobody there. "Stupid teenagers again" - I thought angrily, climbing the stairs to my bedroom. Suddenly, I heard some a strange sound behind me. I turned around quickly, but there was nothing - the sound disappeared had disappeared. I began feeling to feel a bit scared, not that I was afraid of ghosts, but...I had this the impression that something was wrong. I stopped and listened. Nothing. A complete silence. After a minute I started walking up the stairs again and I heard the same sound - it was the sound of footsteps! I was so frightened that I could barely move, but I turned my head again. There was nobody there. But something changed had changed - the kitchen door was wide open. Suddenly I saw a figure of a man, dressed in black, moving towards me. I couldn't believe my own eyes, so I closed them quickly and ran to my sister's room. "Jane" - I shouted - "There is a ghost downstairs! A man, dressed in a black suit!" "I know" - replied my little sister peacefully, - "It's Grandpa. Don't you know it's his birthday today?" "Yes, but our grandpa is dead, don't you remember?" - I cried. "That's right. But haven't you just said you've see seen a GHOST?" - she asked and looked at me as if I had lost my mind.

Dear John ! I was very happy to receive your letter. I haven't heard from you for a long time, how. How are you? How is your sister, Marine? I went on a boat trip with my class last month and it was very exciting and acknowledgeable interesting. We were also very lucky with the weather, ; it was warm and sunny so we could admire the picturesque views all day long. I think you should definetly definitely go and I'll try to help in what any way I can. First of all I recommend you to go go on the 8 a.m. boat. It might mean waking up early but it will be less crowded and more comfortable on the trip. In my opinion a guided tour is essential, because Bourne Castle is a historical place with galleries full of unique works of art and you will need a guide to explain everything thoroughly and answer all the your questions. I think you should take a packed lunch with you, because the restaurant is far too expensive and the portions are too small (you'll get very tired walking around the castle). I advise you to try the watersports water sports as well, it's. It's a real laugh. I'm not sure how many students are there there are in your class but they give reductions for groups of over 15 people so maybe you'll have to invite some friends to join you. By the way, I'd love to come with you, if it's possible! I really enjoyed our trip and I'm eager to see you again! Looking forward to your reply, Love

TV - a powerful force that keeps us glued to itself it for endless hours every day, unable to press the "Off" button on the remote control. Some say it's evil, it spoils our eyes and personality, others say it's useful, enriches our minds with knowledge and helps teens form their individuality. But can each one of these people answer one simple question ! ? "Could you live without television for a week?" I can honestly say: I could. I like TV, I watch it but luckily I haven't become a TV addict yet. Well, maybe only yet. When do we turn on our TV set? When we are bored and lonely or on the contrary on the other hand when we are tired of doing something we dislike. So if I lived without television for a week I'd find something else to keep me busy: invite some friends around, read a good interesting book, go bowling or to a swimming pool. This summer I lived for three weeks in a complete TV vacuum in a complete TV vacuum for three weeks,. I forgot it had ever existed. I just didn't have time for it, didn't allow it to enter my life. And no, it wasn't a self-made torture. I was just having a good time and I didn't need television to support me and keep me company in the dark summer evenings. You might ask me a normal question : "What about the news?" Well, I'm also bothered about what's going on around me but why did you forget have you forgotten about newspapers? And the radio (if you're too lazy to read the news yourself and prefer them it to be read to you!) The biggest difference the absence of TV had made made in my life was that I actually started living. I think everyone can say "no" to TV because humans' will is far more stronger than the invisible hands that lure us into their cave. And it'll be good for you as well, after a week without TV you'll begin to appritiate appreciate it and your life a lot more.

" junk Junk food instead of a carrot" Young man, are you aware of what you eat and drink? Are you sure that your diet is healthy enough to help you grow up ? In today's fast moving fast-moving world young people spend less and less time cooking or eating healthy food. When they are at home, especially children, parents take care of them and always prepare some a good dinner with meat or a fresh salad for supper. However, students who never have time for a healthy diet full of minerals, vitamins or and fibre usually finish on "McDonalds", and hamburgers or Bic Big Macs. Moreover, very often the school canteen doesn't offer diversified varied types of food, like different kinds of bread or salads. Usually we don't eat regularly and or in good proportions. Our grandparents always remembered the value and quality of food. They found time to eat something hot for dinner - the main meal - and even if even though the times were worse poorer, people were more sensible. In my opinion people, especially the young, should become more aware of what and when they eat as well as and they should work on their lifestyles and keep their head.

Dear Pete, I hope you have a fantastic time in New York and please don't worry about your flat. Everything is going to be under control! But I want to make some points clear before you leave London. First of all, I think I'm going to be busy on the 4th of April. Can we change the date into to the 5th of April, at 4 o'clock? Thanks very much for letting me use your things during the my stay. I may need to use particularly the computer and the CD player. Is that OK for with you? By the way, if you tell me around what time you will be back on the 20th, maybe I can prepare something for dinner. I know you're going to be too tired to cook after 11 hours of flight flying. Last of all, thanks for your consideration about bringing me a present. Anything as a souveniere souvenir would be quite enough for me. I'll leave it to you. I know you have a good taste in presents!! Have a great time in the States. Love,

It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. Last July, I went to spend two weeks with my best friend in a beautiful village in the south of France, near Saint-Tropez. We lived stayed in at my aunt's house who which was in the center centre of the village. In front of my aunt's house, there is was a house with a swimming pool, garage and garden. My aunt told me it was the a famous French singer's house. One night, I heard a strange sound. I loocked looked outside and saw two men go into the house in front of mine. They went into the house through a window. I though thought it was some rubbers robbers. I said to my friend that I wanted to go to see and he must phone to the police. I went near the house and waited to look see what it would happen. After ten minutes, one man came out with a big bag and went got into his car. When the other man came out, I caught him and fighted fought him. The first man went away, because a police car arrived. The policeman came to take the bugglar burglar and thanked me for to catch catching him.

I agree with this statement. I think that famous people deserve to have a private life like all the normal people, without journalists following them all the time. A famous person should have the chance to go on his own for a walk without having the annoying impression of being followed. In my opinion the journalists should have more respect for the private life lives of the famous people. They should understand when it is too much, when they are going too far. For instance, the tragic death of Princess Diana is an example of what a journalist must not do. In this occasion instance we can say that the journalists have, of course indirectly, caused her death. On the other hand, the famous people have to understand that the people are interested in their lives. If one is famous, it one has to accept also the disadvantages of be being famous. The famous Famous people must enderstand understand that the journalists are doing their work job. In my view Prince Charles is a good example of how famous people have to deal with the media. When he goes skiing in Switzerland he always stops for a while to talk with the journalists and to give the photographers the chance to take pictures. After this break he continues to ski without be being annoyed for the rest of the holiday. In conclusion I think that there must be more compehension comprehension understanding and respect between famous people and the media.

A DAY OF IN MY LIFE It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. That day, I got up early because I hadn't slept very well. I checked everything again and again. I was afraid of doing to do it but I had to do it. It was the first time I had robbed a bank. I was her best friend. I promised her I would to find find a the money for her operation. She was at the hospital and she was really bad. That At that time, I couldn't imagine how my life would change. After I had had my breakfast I put my clothes on. I didn't want anybody to recognise me. Despite feeling really bad I left home. I got into my car and started it. When I arrived at the bank I got out of the car and went into the bank. I told everybody to lie down. They did it. I asked the cashier to give me all the money. Before I took the money one of the cashier cashiers had pressed a button to call a the police. I quickly left the bank. However, it didn't take long that they for them caught to catch me soon. The policeman arrested me and I stayed was in a prison for 15 years. The worst thing was my friend died after 10 days 10 days after I was arrested.

Famous people, such as politicians and film stars, deserve to have a private life without journalists fellowing following them all the time. Famous people have always been the center centre of interest for a number of people. Their wedding weddings, their holiday holidays, their new haircut haircuts and so on. But do we think enough about the right to have a private life? We can watch consider this problem from two different points of view. From one side On the one hand, this these people chose to become public people figures. If we don't want to be in the newspapers, we don't do go into politics or the movies! But, from the other on the other hand, everybody has the right to have a secret garden, the right to be with his/her family without be being disturbed by journalists and photographers. What I decided to do was getting to get into the house by climbing up on the roof because I knew one of the windows was unlocked. First, I climbed the tree in the garden. My dream It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. I had always wanted to swim in the middle of with sharks. I lived in a small village on the ocean. My father was a captain on a huge boat. When I was a child, I used to go with him travelling from harbours harbour to harbours harbour. I grew up through the water world and I couldn't live whitout without it. Once I was fishing, when sharks came appeared all around me. I got the strange feeling I could jump and follow them. Since this famous experience, I dreamt every night about that about that every night. One Saturday I got on into my motorboat and rode far away from the reef. My father was sitting next to me, thinking that I was crazy. Some minutes later I was doing it, spending time with the fish, swimming round the sharks. I had done what I had never expected to do. Now I can die in freedom.

Many people think that it is natural for famous people to be followed by journalists all the time because they are famous and everybody is curious about their life. However, in my opinion, famous people, such as politicians and film actors, deserve to have a private life. First of all, everybody has rights to keep their own private life life private, especially when they are in serious situations such as divorce and or a family member's or the closest friend's death. It is too cruel for them to be have monitored their feelings their feeling monitored at that time. Another reason that I agree that famous people deserve to have a private life is that if journalists followed them all the time, it would result in their death. For example, if Diana, who was the ex-wife of Prince Charles, hadn't been followed by paparachi paparazzi when she was dating with a guy man, there wouldn't have been a car accident which caused her death. To sum up, nobody wants to be revealed their private life their private life to be revealed on in public. Therefore, even famous people need their own life apart from the media.

It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. I went out of the room, ran as much far as I could and started thinking about what this man was doing here and who he was. When I arrived in the street it was dark, and windy, but I could see a shadow at the corner of the opposite street street opposite. By the time I arrived here there, he has had disappeared. Suddenly, I felt very tired and decided to go home. My sister was standing, crying and showing the front door. I took her in my arms and opened the door: my mother was sitting in a chair, reading a book, with blood all around her. I finally realized that she was dead. The police arrived twenty minutes later, took my mother and checked to see what could be interesting useful to find the murder murderer : lucky luckily, the knife which he used to kill her was still here there and in fact they could were able to arrested arrest him. They found hime him two months after later and six months after later he was in jail. To forget everything, I moved to Irkind with my sister in to a small house in the countryside. Everything was going on, when one day, I came went in into the house and found my mother sitting in a chair reading a book, with blood all around her.

In a country like the UK, we are all bound to have houses. We either own it, or we simply borrow it from other people. We take our homes for granted. Think about the people in the poor countries! They struggle to survive. However, as we approach the future, our homes will start to change. Have you ever thought about how the changes will affect our lives? I doubt it. There will be lots of differences in our homes of the future from our homes now, but there may also be a lot of similarities. For one, the future homes home might not be built out of bricks at all! It may be built out of a stronger substance or a more attractive one, such as glass. Non-breakable glass. Also, due to global warming, sea levels might rise and the risk of flooding will also rise. Therefore, houses will be built on high supports. All domestic appliances such as showers, kettles, lights, TV and curtains may be voice activated. Incredibly high security will prevent robbery. The future homes will also have many similarities, such as having a separate bathroom, and not having one in a bedroom, or having two floors or having garages. It has been a pleasure sharing my thoughts with you. What do you think will happen in the future?

I It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. I had absolutely no choice. We had walked for three hours (my mother, my two brother brothers and I) through the humid and noisy jungle, looking forward to reach reaching a small but clean house where a nice and friendly family, old friends of us ours, used to live. The path we were walking in on was quite clean and I was feeling really happy and relaxed... until we reached a river. There were was nor neither a bridge nor a canoe, the. The only way to cross it was by walking on an old big a big old tree trunk which was lying down, peacefully, making the only connection bridge between our side and the other. My mother and brothers had already crossed the river, and they were encouraging me to do the same from the other side of it, but I was paralysed with fear. Then, I suddenly realised that I had no choice, so I took summoned all my courage, took a big deep breath, and crossed it! It was easier than I had thought!. That day, I learnt that I can do even even do things which, at first sight, seem impossible to be done do.

"It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it." Nowadays I remember those exciting days in which danger is was knocking at your door every day. It was 20 years ago and we were had been friends since we were 10. In those days we decide decided to be friends forever and work for the NASA. I remember it as if it were yesterday. We were both 18, and we had the university access test already done. The problem was that both of us wanted to go to the same university, the NASA university in Houston (Texas). Of course we hadn't got enough points in the test to do it so. So, that, we decide to access our school school's Main database and change our test results. This way we could obtain seldom rare places at NASA university. The task was not easy, with at 18 you don't know too much about cryptographic algoritms algorithms and databases but anyway we decided to do it there. There was nothing to lose. It took us two weeks to modify the results in a very complex operation in which we should take care of hiding hiding all our fingerprints. The operation operation was successful. Both of us went to the NASA university and nowadays we work for the CIA developing secure system systems and new encryptation encryption algorithms.

"It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it, " Peter whispered, smiling at me. it It was a cold, stormy, winter's night outside. The wind was blowing and the heavy rain was drumming agaist against our bedroom window. I could hear a an owl hooting in the tree nearby. My husband and I were sitting on our bed. Peter, my husband, was a tall, strong man in his mid-forty mid-forties. We used to remember recount our daytime day before felling falling asleep. As a postman, Peter, had to deliver letters aroud around our little village. He knew everybody, especially including Mrs Rilke, an elderly, eagle-eyed teacher in retirement retired retired teacher, who lived in a an old cottage with her five bad-tempered dogs. She has had never received any letter letters, since till that morning. "She was very angry when I arrived. She stared suspiciously at me through her the glasses on the tip of her nose. After I had opened her gate, she called loudly to her five, horrible dogs. I realised I had to run away, but I had still still had her letter. Suddenly I made up my mind, and running as fast as a champion horse I reached her hands and left the letter, then I went away quickly and, fortunately, was just in time to close the gate between me and the dogs! "

It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. It was a new challenge, and not only for me, but for everyone there. Nobody thought I was capable of doing it. I wasn't sure of what to do, and the pressure of everyone watching me, was driving me mad. Finally, I managed to move my right foot closer to the edge. I could listen hear the crowd shouting 'Go, Go go '. That was my only chance.. Only a few more seconds, otherwise my time turn would be over. I didn't even think of boking looking down. I was already paralysed, and that wouldn't help me at all. Then, by some 'strange power', my left foot was moving and I wanted to stop it, but it was too difficult. The clock was running.. tic tick, tac tock... And suddenly everything stopped. I felt an enourmous enormous peace. Somehow I managed to jump out of the airplane and I was flying! Those minutes, up in the air, feeling the wind in my face, were fantastic....And then I was terrified when I couldn't open the parachute! Fortunatelly Fortunately, I wasn't alone.

The home of the future The view from outside will mainly be the same. The houses will look like the houses of today. A simple and well-proofen well-proven architecture. The difference will be inside the buildings. The doors would be the entrance to another world.... The fridge, the television, the stove and the Hi-Fi hi-fi equipment will be attached to a computer network. Every electronic gadget in the futur future home will be able to comunicate communicate with other machines or computers. It will be possible to connect to the Internet from nearly everywhere in the house or flat. I'm sure all the things which are based on electronic parts will totally change. Also the aspects of security within people's homes. But I think there will not be many changes concerning the furnishing of the future homes. All the big and small things which are defining define people's personal environment will be left nearly unchanged - the furniture, the pictures on the wall.... I suppose our future homes will be a mix of new technologies and good old tradition. It has always been like that.

An A especiall especial special invitation It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. I was having a holidays holiday with my parents and some friends in India and we were enjoying talking to people and eating the local food. One day we were invited from by some locals to visit a little town five hours away from New Dehli. Although my parents were very happy of about having such an a especial special opportunity of visiting a place with no tourists, I was a little bit scared. In this country my parents used to buy water in bottles to have it clean, but in the little town we didn't had have this possibility the chance to do this and the family where we were staying with, kindly boiled the water for us. We spent 2 weeks with the family. The first week was find fine, but on in the second week I got very seek sick. I think it was the water. My mother tried to get a doctor, but they said there was no one. Some days later we went back to Dehli and, having being been to the doctor and having again drunk bottled water, I was feeling healthy again.

The home of the Future If you think in of the future you could might think in of faster and better machines, advanced technology or a better life. All this will happen in the next 50 years, how can we be prepared to receive all these things in our homes? The next 50 years. Nowadays, our home life allow allows us to have more free time to spend doing leisure activities like practising sports or going out. In the close near future we will be able to do nothing because everything will be done by computers and machines, ( the washing-up, hovering hoovering, ironing, gardening, cooking, etc. ) The question is, will it be a better life? On the one hand, we will be able to spend more time with our family and not to be be worried about anything. No more housework, no more stress, nor no more illnesses; everything will be perfect. On the other hand, life will be boring, a large amount of workers will be have redundant and housewives will not have anything to do, which will be extremely boring and tedious. What do you prefer? Do you enjoy doing nothing or do you really enjoy what you do? It is your desicion decision.

Terror in the Alps It was dangerous, but I knew I had to do it. We had been trapped in the snowy, almost vertical slopes of the "Tête Blanche" for more than ten hours by then. We were there, alone, my friend with his broken leg and myself. We had decided to climb that more than 3'700 3,700 -metre-high mountain near Arolla in Switzerland two weeks beforehand. We had been preparing the trip for several days when we started to climb the mountain, on that the 4th of September 1995. It all went as expected and we reached the summit in six hours. However, it started to go wrong after one hour of downhill walking. My friend fell down and badly hit his leg against a rock. We could immediatly immediately see that it was broken. He couldn't move any more and my mobilephone mobile phone was not able to find a proper network. We were trapped! I finally decided to carry him on my back on the way back to the rescue chalet. It was dangerous because of the steepness of the slope and we risked falling down all the time. However, we would have frozen to death if we had stood stayed where we were. After ten more exhausting hours of walking we finally reached the chalet, from which where we were able to call a helicopter. We were safe!

It was dangerous but I knew I had to do it. George was about to be linched lynched on account of his colour skin skin colour. Someone had to react... I had to react!... otherwise I would have felt responsible for his death, for the rest of my life. George was leaning lying on the floor, surrounded by his own lake of blood. He had just been beaten by a ground group of white men. And yet, he was too weak to resist the rats, coming from everywhere and eating his face, his legs and his arms, waiting with great impatience for his death. He had been chained and no way could he escape from his fate without some help! The place where I was hidden was overlooking the house where he was kept prisonner prisoner. The respect of Famous people's private life lives has always been a hot topic... On the one hand, those people are equal to like us in the way that they had a childhood, thy they got married and built had a family... The only difference between them and us is the kind of job they are doing, which is literally a "public job". Therefore, why do we have to talk and gossip about them?! But on the other hand, the aim of a "public job", such as politician or actor, is to be known and appreciated by the population. And here comes the paradox : Do we have to reveal someone's privacy to judge his work and appreciate him? Well, some people would agree say yes whereas others would desagree disagree. I guess this is an unanswerable question... As far as I'm concerned, I would say that famous people made the choice decision to be followed and tracked by journalists all the time, when they chose to be famous. That's It's as simple as this that ! Everyone is aware of the celebrity's consequences predicament so, if they really wanted their privacy, why did they choose a "public job"?? Even if anyone everyone deserve deserves to have a private life, famous people know and might have made a mistake... However, I would add that journalists - being aware of that hard topic - should try to modorate moderate what they write in order to respect altrui's other people's privacy; since they would probably not be glad happy to have their own private life revealed exposed ! But to solve this problem, we may must think first about its origin... "Reading the gossips gossip ": isn't it what anyone all of us love doing?? Therefore we should try to educate ourselves so as to respect altrui other people in his privacy. Why not? To conclude, I would say that "privacy" and "celebrity" can't go together. It's just a matter of choice: being aware of that problem, everyone is free to become famous or not... !

"THE RIGHT PERSON" MAY 29, 1997. IT WAS MY FIRST TIME IN LONDON. THAT NIGHT, I WENT TO A PUB IN BAYSWATER. WHEN THEY CLOSED, I TOOK THE NUMBER 7 BUS. BUT THAT DAY, LIKE AS I WAS KIND OF DRUNK, I DIDN'T REALISE THAT THE BUS TOOK A DIFFERENT WAY ROUTE ;. SO, WHEN I NOTICED IT, THE DRIVER WAS ALREADY ASKING ME TO GET OFF, BECAUSE WE WHERE WERE IN THE GARAGE IN PORTOBELLO. I TOLD HIM, I DIDN'T KNOW WHERE I WAS, BUT HE JUST SEID SAID SORRY. I WAS REALY REALLY SCARE SCARED. THERE WERE SOME PEOPLE AROUN AROUND BUT I WAS AFRAID TO ASK THEM THE WAY I SHOULD TAKE. AT LEAST LAST FINALLY I ASKED A BOY AND HE SAID "I'LL TELL YOU WHERE IS THE PLACE YOU ARE LOOKING FOR THE PLACE YOU ARE LOOKING FOR IS, JUST FOLLOW ME". IT WAS DANGEROUS, BUT I KNEW I HAD TO DO IT. 10 MINUTES AFTER I WAS FOLLOWING HIM AFTER FILLOWING HIM FOR 10 MINUTES, I START STARTED KNOWING TO KNOW TO RECOGNISE THE PLACE, AND I WAS FELLING FEELING MORE CONFORTABLE COMFORTABLE. HE TOOK ME RIGHT IN TO THE FRONT OF MY HOUSE. I THANK THANKED HIM SO VERY MUCH, AND I WAS SO HAPPY THAT I ASKED TO THE RIGHT PERSON AND NOTHING WRON WRONG BAD HAPPEN HAPPENED TO ME.

The Home of the Future Dear Reader, I have decided to describe my home of the future or, in other words, the place where people will live in 100 years. Perhaps, there will be personal computers, which will control every thing everything, every item of furiture furniture, light, temperature. Moreover, they will be able to create a special climate for each room. But, on the other hand, people will still have to programm programme them, as they have to do nowadays. Maybe children will not have to go to school, they just will will just stay in their rooms and study from on a computer, gaining some kind of on-line education. All the rubbish, dust, dirty dishes, plates, caps cups will be washed and cleaned washed automaticly automatically. It is possible that only one computer will do this all all this and it will have its own personality, voice, eyesight.. This will be your home, another member of your family and your house or flat together as well. This is my opinion vision of the Home of the Future and I wish I could live in it.

Dear Jane, I am very happy because I haven't received hadn't received any letter from you, for a long time, and as I had a problem with my mother's health, not a serious one, I didn't write to you. I hope you are fine. First of all, you musn't mustn't panic. It's not a serious enough problem to get upset. You must be very happy because you have been offed offered two jobs. In my opinion, as you're really very keen on history, I think that the ideal job for you is to work in a museum. Now I don't know if it is tiring but I suppose it will be less tiring than a place job in a restaurant. If I were in your shoes, I would choose the position to in the museum because it is more stimulating and as the pay is about the same, I think that this choice is the best for you. But you should wonder consider which working place workplace is more convenient to for you. You'd do better not to travel far away from your home. Also working in a museum may include big tips from the tourists. Apart from these this, despite the fact that it is a summer job, you could be employed for the whole of next year, if you are lucky. Last but not last Last but not least, I hope you will find my opinion helpful. I wish hope your problem will be solved, but I don't think that it's about a problem. Whatever choice you will make make, I'm sure it will be the best for you. Drop me a line. Lots of Love love,

Dear Ms. Belinda Marriott, My name is Akihiro and I'm a member of an English club at West Isle College. I'm writing this letter to invite you to the event which I'm organizing for people who want to improve their English, as our teacher told me that you have come to live in our area. Our English club is not a very big one, with 14 students and a teacher. Most of the students are between 18 and 22 years old, but there are some elder older students, the. The eldest is 28 years old. We all love to learn English. At the event, I'd like you to give us a speech. You can tell us about whatever you like. For example, a speech about your latest work would be very nice. I'm planning the event on for 15 or 22 February, from 7 to 8 p.m. Please tell me which day is good for you. After the event, I'd like to offer you a dinner at a Japanese restaurant near our college. I'm looking forward to hearing from you. Sincerely yours,

I had never taken birthdays serious seriously, both neither my own and nor those of others, until I had that really special day on my twenty-fourth birthday. I was born in May, which is the busiest month for school teachers in Japan. Unfortunately, both of my parents are teachers. In my childhood, they were always too busy to remember my birthday and I didn't remember my birthday either. When I was 23, I joined a an NGO in Denmark and stared started living with other members, most of who whom are from Europe. On that day, I noticed that they were preparing something for me and that reminded me that it was my birthday. I had never had a birthday party before and I didn't expect much. The party was far beyound beyond my expectation expectations. 20 Twenty people from five different countries celebrated for with me. I had never felt happier. I still often forget my birthday, but I will never forget that special one I had two years ago.

Can you imagine your life without any computers at all? Well, I am sure that you can hardly do this unless you are living deep in a forest or in a dessert desert ! If you think about how many computers we use every day and how dependent we are on them, it must be clear to you that the invention of computers has certainly had a significant impact on all our lives. For example, all infrastructures, such as public transports transport and power stations, are ran run using computers, the government uses them to organise all sorts of things in a country, and all kids kinds of services institutions and businesses, such as hospitals and supermarkets, use them as essential capitals. In other words, almost all aspects of our lives today rely on computers. So I am sure from this that it is convincing enough to say that invention of computers is really important. From my personal experience, I can also say that a personal computer is also an amazing tool. It improves the productivity of my homework, that which is involves often often involves essay writing, and also it allows me to access to the internet Internet. Since I live abroad, the internet Internet is really useful for me to have a contact with my bestfriend best friend and when I want to know what is going on in my home country. To sum up, I can say that the greatest ever invention is the invention of computers, that which has affected both indivisuals individuals and a society as a whole.

Nevertheless, I am both pleased and honoured to expect you and your group in the context of our international meeting. We have made arrangements for you to stay at the Palace Hotel. Furthermore, since it is located between the airport and our location, a bus shuttle shuttle bus has been organised to pick take all our guests from the hotel to the conference room. The end-of-conference party is to be held at in the 'Royal Room' of the hotel, which has an outstanding reputation for its quality and seriousness. Therefore, all the guests will be asked to wear the corresponding appropriate clothes in order to be accepted. As for the three hours of free time, I strongly suggest you to check-in check in check in your lugages luggages luggage check your luggage in at the airport and then, after a five-minutes five-minute bus ride, spend your time in the marvellous 'Old City'. Best Regards,

My fair Mobile Phone. It becomes then then becomes a real obsession for the average students student, as e he uses it before the lessons, during the lessons, during lunch and, especially, during examinations... INVENTIONS HAVE AFFECTED ALL OUR LIVES! The invention without no any doubt Without any doubt the invention, that has affected my own life by far the most is the car. Cars have definitely changed all our lives, and I am not refering referring only in a positive way, but in a negative way as well. Picture this: a big city such as London or New York with no cars on their streets. Could Can you imagine it? To be honest, I can't. Cars are part of our daily lives. Traffic jams make people nervous irritable, and sometimes really upset and violent. But, anyway, people use cars people use cars, anyway. If we don't use them we suffer from because of them. In my case I use public transport during the week to go to work but I could hardly imagine my weekends without my beloved car. I really need it to escape from the pollution, mainly caused by cars and any other four-wheel motored motor vehicle vehicles. Isn't that contradictorious contradictory ironic ? To go to the countryside and being be able to breath breathe fresh, non-polluted unpolluted air, I use my car, which, as far as I am concerned in my opinion, does not help to maintain a clean air atmosphere at all. Therefore I am thinking in of selling my car, which has changed my life over the last 10 years, which has given me a kind of freedom, which has gone with me to all sort sorts of fantastic places, and change changed my life for a new life: whithout without a car.

Alice knew that is was going to be a very special day for her. She had a dream where somebody told her that that day would be special. So, she took the bus, like every morning, and she went to school. But that day was a little bit different: she had her maths exam. She had never passed an a maths exam and she was really nervous. Half an hour before the exam she went to the cafeteria to take have a cup of tea. She sat down and, what a surprise, she found a lottery ticket. Nobody was around her, so she took the ticket. Drank, drank her cup of tea and she went to the classroom where the exam took place. She did the exam really well did really well in the exam, she was very surprised, and after the exam she went home. She spend spent the rest of the day listening to music while she was thinking about the lottery ticket and waiting for the TV show at 8 o'clock. At the that time, she turned on the TV and while the lottery's lottery man was shouting out the winning numbers, she checked hers and what was the surprise a surprise it was that the last 4 numbers were the same!! She win won £500!!!

As it is widely known, lots of different and important things were invented during the 20th century, nevertheless I believe that the most important one is the computer. It is a fact, that the modern society have has created the demand for the an ability to cope with the vast amounts of information. Taking it that into consideration I would like to say that the computer is the a priceless invention for an accountants, designers, engineers and so on and on. Another point in their favour advantage is the their possibility ability to connect to the Internet. It allows you to have all the necessary information " on your fingertips at your fingertips ". Also not least importantly is the role of computers in the process of production in factories around the world. On the other hand there are some disadvantages. For instance a lot of children nowadays replace their real life with the a virtual world, which computers create. Another drawback is that in industry computers replace people's labour, which leads to the increasing of unemployment. To conclude I would like to say that the goverments governments of all developed countries wouldn't have been so concerned about the so-called "problem 2000" if the computer had not been so important for the modern society.

To In my personal opinion one of the most important and useful thing things which has been invented in is a the car. Cars take play a big part in our life. Everywhere you look you can see cars. More and more people learn are learning how to drive and choose choosing to travel by car, because it saves a lot of time comper compare compared to travelling by public transport. Cars are also more reliable than other types of transport. You don't have to wait on at a bus stop on in a cold and windy weather for a late bus, or being be stuck on a train for an hour due to some railtrack track repairs, you. You can just jump into a car, tune your radio onto to your favourite station and have a plesant pleasant drive to your distanation destination. Cars are even more important for emergency situations such as a fire in a house or if somebody is critically ill. Could you imagine if our police, doctors or fire-fighters had to get somewhere quickly on foot? I don't think I need to comment on this. From my personal experience I realised how it's important to drive a car when I was living in Johanesburg in South Africa. I arrived there with my family when my daughter was only 4 months old and I couldn't drive at that time. Johanesburg is a very dangerous place to live. I couldn't just go for a walk, it was too dangerous. There was no public transport and I had to stay in the complex where we lived most of the time, and relay rely on other people to take me to a shop or the doctors or anywhere else. There I soon realised that I had to learn how to drive if I wanted a some quality of life for my daughter and myself. Since I passed my driving test I can not cannot understand how I used to live without a car before. I use my car every day everywhere I go and I absolutelly absolutely love it!

Report. Introduction: The purpose of this report is to give a brief discription description of the Academy of Art in St.-Petersburg St Petersburg. From my point of view In my opinion this building is the best option place to visit. Location: This building is situated on the magnificent embankment bank of the Niva River with an exellent excellent view on of the Hermitage Museum. History: The building was built by a very famious famous Russian architect and is a marvellouse marvellous example of Russian classic architerture architecture of the XVIIIth XVIII century. Facilities: In the Academy of Art you can find the oldiest oldest art libarary library, with a wide range of books, and the Museum of Russian Art, with a huge collection of painting paintings, sculpture and architectural projects from the early eighteenth to late twentieth centuries. It is also a good chance opportunity to be introduced with to the Russian system of art education. Conclusion: The building of the Academy of Art in St.-Petersburg St Petersburg is worth visiting and interesting as because of its historical historic as and educational aspects.

"Sagrada Familia", a real holly holy building. If you are looking for a special building in Barcelona, which you can will like whatever your tastes are, you should visit the "Sagrada Familia". Gaudi conceived of this church n in 1912, though it wasn't until 1920 they started to build it. Since the beginning the work was has been interrupted in at different periods times and started again. . Report on Kyoung Bok Palace - the Glory of Chosun Kingdom.. Introduction. This report provides the information about Kyong Bok Palace, which is highly recommended to visit for visitors from foreign countries for visitors from foreign countries to visit. It highlights the background history and considers the interest of young peoples people, and makes a final recommendation.. History. The kingdom Chosun has a history for of 500 years and lasted until the beginning of the 20th century. Kyong Bok Palace was the main residence of the royal family, so you will be able to imagine its size. As the kings of Chosun loved to be a part of the nature, the palace had a huge garden, however it was destroyed by the army of Japan Japanese army, and now there remains only a part of the original palace. There is a special monument for to the last queen of Chosun who was killed by the Japanese army.. Activity. The reason that this palace is also popular for the youngsters, who tends tend to dislike the historical visit visits, would be the various activity activities. You can try the traditional games of Korea and there is a chance to wear the traditional clothes of the Royals. Also there are performances which helds are held daily in at the front gate of the palace.. Final Recommendation. It is out of question It is out of the question not to visit Kyong Bok Palace unless you do not want to know about Korean history. You will find many interesting points there, therefore, I urge you to visit the place, if you want to experience the tradition of Korea.

THE HYSTORICAL HISTORICAL MUSEUM Welcome to Athens!! Without any doubt, it is a hystorical historical place which provides it's its visitors with the opportunity to discover different aspects of the greek Greek history during the passing of the centuries. Don't miss the chance to visit the hystorical historical museum, located in the heart of the capital city. A traditional building which was built at the beginning of the century. The, the hystorical historical museum is simply a symbol, a proof of what the greek Greek Greeks have always considered as a main fundamental principal principle : their freedom. There are five diffrent different floors, each of them presents a diffrent different chronical chronological period of greek Greek history, starting from the period before the birth of Juisus Jesus and concluding to with the revolution of 1967. The museum provides the visitor with the opportunity to see original pieces of writing, famous paintings having as their main subject the revolution of 1821, and aspects of the greek Greek religion that has have always been considered to be a vital part of greek Greek history. There is a small amount of money that visitors should pay for entry entry fee. Inside the museum there is a bookshop having with a large variety of hystorical historical books, maps etc. If you really want to discover what greek Greek history means, we strongly recommend you to visit the hystorical historical museum!!!

To: (group leader) From: Subject: Bournemouth National Museum As requested I visited the Bournemouth National Museum, which is, to my mind, one of the most interesting buildings of the area. Below is a summary of the most important relevant points and some recommendations you may need. 1. Architecture The architecture of the building in itself is really breathtaking in terms of luxury and ornamentation choice. Even if the architectural style may seem a bit ' heavy, this building is really a masterpiece with no similar real comparison all over anywhere in the world. 2. Exposition Although I have to admit that it is very tiring to visit the whole museum in one day, it is such a rewarding and enriching time experience that people get never never get tired of looking at the paintings and sculptures of in each section of the museum. 3. Restaurant The adjoining restaurant is very enjoyable good as well. The waiters are friendly and always ready to give advice. In fact it is just what visitors need after their trip through the museum. To sum up, I would say that this museum is more interesting than the other museums, because you can enjoy not only wonderful masterpieces but also a very uncommon unusual architecture and a quiet restaurant where you will be able to have a rest if you need to.

Could modern people live without a light bulb? Well, I don't think so. Only The only people who could live without it one, must would be extremely weird or somebody in a very difficult situation! We are nearly always surrounded by the 'man-made' light. With it, we read, study, walk, and so on. In the past people relied on the sunlight, moonlight and the light from fire. These were, however, very unreliable when the weather was bad and when the fuel ran out. They had to read, study and walk in the dark. Today, this kind of thing hardly ever happens! Well, unless there wasn't is anything something wrong with the power supply. I remember when I was about 5, I visited a museum with my family. While I was in the toilet, all the light lights was turned went off! I screamed and cried since I'd never experienced being in a complete darkness before. When the light was turned on again, I realised how important even a single light bulb would can be, and I was sure I can could never, ever live without it one.

TO: Leader of the group of American students FROM: DATE: 12.06.2001. SUBJECT: Recomnendations Recommendations of for a place to visit INTRODUCTION: The aim of this report is to give a description and make a recommendation of concerning the most interesting building in the town. GENERAL INFORMATION: The place I would like to recommend is the seventienth seventeenth -century Royal Palace. It is situated in a the heart of Warsaw and surrounded by the buildings of an the Old Town. There is a square old Market market an old market square with the magnificent statue of the King Zygmunt, in the centre of it. FACILITIES:. Inside the Palace, there is a museum of with an antique collection of porcalaine porcelain a collection of antique porcelain.. There is also a Portrait Gallery in the left wing of the Palace.. The Old Town is the best place for an afternoon stroll, with a great deal of restaurants, caffes cafes and street performers.. There is an easy reach to cashpoints, lavatories toilets, emergency services, etc Cashpoints, toilets, emergency services etc are within easy reach. POSITIVE POINTS. It is easy to get there by any sort of public transport.. There are a numbers number of hotels or youth hostels to stay overninight overnight, if necessary.. Most of the admissions Admission to most places are is absolutely free. NEGATIVE POINTS. A part of the Palace might be closed, due to the constant ongoing renovations.. All the facilities are usually overcrowded during a the summer holiday. CONCLUSION: Despite the few drawbacks, I would strongly recommend the Royal Palace as the most suitable place to visit for the foreign students.

OLYMPIQUE OLYMPIC MUSEUM The aim of this report is to give you further informations information on an interesting building to visit in Lausanne. It is based on my own experience. WHY THE OLYMPIC MUSEUM. ? The Olympique Olympic Museum is situated near the lake and offer offers, for the tourist, an unbelievable view on of the mountains and the lake. First of all, the main interest of the museum is the olympic Olympic history. You can find a lot of documentary documentaries documents about it and you have several competitors personal objects. In addition, you can play with several interactive game games and learn about the rules of the olympic Olympic games. REASONS OF FOR RECOMMENDATION. The principal reason is the cheapest cheap price. On the other hand, if you there are more than 10 people, you can have pay a group price and pay only 6 Frs per person. It seems that this solution option might be the best way to visit this museum. CONCLUSION. To sum up, the Olympic Museum is a very attractive place and could be a good trip with your family or your student group. Therefore, if you want to learn something about the Olympic Games, it must be the best place for this you.

From: Genevieve Chiu To: Group The group leader of the American students Subject: Interesting building to visit in Hong Kong Visiting Po Lin Temple The purpose of this is to give information to the American students, describing Po Lin Temple, which is worth-visited worth visited worth visiting. 1. Brief history of Po Lin Temple: It was found founded in 1910. It is a traditional type of chinese Chinese temple. Because of the 2nd World War, it was re-built in 1960. A big Buhha Buddha was built in 1997 just next to the temple, which and it is the largest outdoor Buhha Buddha in the world. 2. Location: The location of Po Lin Temple is in on Lotus Island, which is the second biggest island in Hong Kong. 3. Opening and Closing time: Po Lin Temple is opened open to the public from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm on Monday to Friday, and 9:00 am to 5:30 pm on Saturday and Sunday. 4. Transports Transport You could take the MTR (HK underground) straight to Lotus Island or take the ferry to get there. Then you need to take the bus, an A110, A111 or A112, to Po Lin Temple. It is quite convenient. All the buses and the MTR have air-condition air-conditioning. 5. Attractive points: You could go sightseeing around the Temple and take photos. Of course, you may get acquire more a greater knowledge about of Hong Kong, as the temple have has been here for nearly 100 years. The well known well-known famous Big Buhha Buddha you mustn't miss it You mustn't miss the famous Big Buddha, or you will be sorry. The temple also provide provides free Chinese traditional style traditional-style meals for visitors. 6. Conclusion: To sum up, I think Po Lin Temple is a nice place to visit, especially for Americans students. Easy It is easy to get there and free amittion admission. On the other hand, Hong Kong is known as a highly commerical commercial city, but and you could find something different in Po Lin Temple.

REPORT: TO: MR FROM: DATE: 21ST JUNE 2000 INTRODUCTION: As requested, the aim of this report is to assess the suitbility suitability for a group of American students for of the visit at to the Etruscan Museum. GENERAL INFORMATION: The museum is situated in the centre of Populoniou, the picturesque fishing village on the Etruscan Coast. Populoniou is about 15 Km. from Piombino and it can be reached by a well-organised means of transport. DESCRIPTION: The Etruscan Museum is one of the most attractive building buildings in my town. It contains lots of archeological archaeological Etruscans founded and some remains about from the Etruscans Estruscans' neoropolis necropolis. The entrance fee is £7 for each student. POSITIVE ASPECTS 1. The Museum is well-organised well organised for tourists. There are some shops, a café and toilets. Also there are some free handphones headphones, that explain the history of the museum. 2. After their visit into to the Museum, they could enjoy the superb view of the sea and the tuscan Tuscan Archipelago, and they could have a pic-nic picnic on the beach. NEGATIVE ASPECTS 1. The negative aspect of the museum is that it is quite expensive for students. CONCLUSION: Although the entrance fee is quite expensive for a group of students, I strongly reccomend recommend it for their excursion and because of their interests.

THE MOBILE PHONE The mobile phone has completely changed our lives, it is an instrument which I cannot imagine myself living without. Apart from being in-fashion in fashion, it is also a very helpful machine. Do you remember that day when you got stuck in the middle of the road with your car which wouldn't work? What would you have done in at that moment without a mobile phone? You were at home in less than ten minutes just because you had a mobile phone with you, amazing, isn't it? Nowadays, everyone has a mobile phone. I am fifteen years old and everybody in my year has got a mobile phone. Five years ago you wouldn't have even thought about it. It has been a plus for me. For example, now my parents allow me to go to more places just because I have my mobile with me, and, sending text messages is an addiction which every teenager is obsessed with. All over All in all, the invention of this little device is a big plus for everyone.

Best choice Welcome to London. You asked me for about an interesting building to visit. In my opinion, I'll recommend I recommend the British Museum. One of the reasons is you can learn almost everything about British history there. The museum looks very old, as like some other buildings in London, but it is very modern inside. After going through the enormous main door, you can see a huge white round round white building, which is a library. A lot of famous people have been to this library before ! The British Hall is on the first floor, not far from the library. It shows a large number of valuable things. Almost each every one tells you a story or gives you a picture about of British history. I'm sure all the students will gain a wonderful lesson ! Apart from the national history, there are more content contents about the past history of the world. You can go to many sections such as the Asia Asian Hall, Egypt Egyptian Hall, Europe European Hall and so on. Countless The countless fascinating things will definely definitely take you the whole day to appreciate. After a visit to the British Museum, you will be certainly certainly be able to put your history textbook away! Also you don't have to pay any money for it, and the transport is extremely convenient, therefore the British Museum is your best choice. Don't be hesitant any more!

The car: I think that the car is one of the human inventions that has the most affected the way of life of people from industrial countries. The industrial countries have encountered deep great evolution change of in their strictures structures since the car has been made available to everyone. At the beginning of the last Century century only a few very rich people could afford a car; it was a kind of leisure or sport to drive one. Today almost everyone owns a car and needs it for daily activities. The transport network has changed according to in accordance with this social evolution. The increasing number of cars related and infrastructure are is now creeting creating problems. A lot of roads and motorways are overcrowded, and enviromment environment environmental issues problems are more and more related to the intensive use of cars and lorries. People and governments are concerned about how to limit the effects of cars on the enviromment environment without impacting affecting their mobility. This will be a tough challenge for this new century.

Dear Sir or Madam, I'm writing in reply to your letter in which you asked me for information on an interesting building to visit. There is are so many places of interest in Lausanne, but I think that the Olympic Museum is the most notable for the following reasons: The Olympic Museum dates from the 19th century and is the biggest in Europe. It shows all the different sports men have been doing since the first Olympic Games in Greece. You can see the evolution of sports and understand why changes gradually have been done made to improve them. You can admire every kind of equipments equipment you need to do any particular sport. You will be informed about the story history of sport in general and about the new technologies which are used nowaday nowadays n in high competitions. The museum is near the city center centre and is accessible by bus or walking. It will takes take you an afternoon to visit it and then you can enjoy a drink or a meal in the restaurant on the third floor, which is well-known well known for being one of the best establishment establishments in Lausanne. I hope my recommendations will help you in the choice of a building to visit. Yours faithfully,

The telephone, a blessing. Who of you could imagine life without the telephone? Not being able to call your friend and ask if you can pop in over for a moment? Not being able to lie to your mother-in-law and pretend you can't attend her garden party because of an illness, without having to look her in the eye? When Alexander Graham Bell first invented the telephone, he had no idea of how popular it would be one day. Its first appliance application was in order to listen to a concert if you were not able to attend it in person. Nowadays, however, the whole world is connected by a telephone system and no one could can imagine life without it. Take me, for example, I use it whenever there is a problem and I need some advice, or when I have to call off a meeting for any reason. I cannot always walk to the person and say "Sorry, I must cancel our meeting", because then it's too late anyway, isn't it? Life definitely wouldn't be the same without the invention of the telephone. We use it daily in order to get information or to pass it on. Just try to spend one week without using a telephone at all, and you will see that it is impossible to do so. So don't take the telephone for granted, but keep in mind that our modern way of life is mainly due to its invention.

Report on the "Paintings Museum" In order to write this report, I spent hours in this wonderful museum. There, I saw the exibitions exhibitions and admired the building itself. I walked around the garden too. Location The museum is located in Ouchy, in front of opposite the "Delamuraz Hotel". It is close to the main road, and at 300 meters metres of from the station. Outside The building is made of white stones. It has two floors. Before going inside, you have to pas pass through the huge garden. There, ponds, pools, trees, flowers and ducks can be admired. I recommend you to take your swim suit swimsuit, because in summer, it is allowed to swim in the pools. Inside When you are inside the museum, you will be impressed by the paintings on the walls. There They were all painting painted during the war by nurses. If you go down a few steps, you will discover the ceilar cellar. Everything in this room is about connected with wine. To learn the whole history of the building, there is a room dedicated to it on the first floor. I particularly recommend you to visit the "blue" room. Everything in this room is blue, the carpet, the ceiling and even the door. According to the owner, it was a room where in the past people used to go when they were depressed. Conclusion To sum up, I would like to add that this house is the most famous in our city. You should come and visit it for the paintings or for the building itself. You won't be disappointed. The only negative point is that you have to pay 10 francs to visit. the house and the garden.
